parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: fetchAllApexSoapMetadata
parameter.description: If checked then Datasense is performed for all Apex classes in the organization, otherwise it is performed only for the classes in Apex class names. If the organization contains a lot of Apex classes this might cause ConnectionTimeout during Datasense. Default value is false.

parameter.name: fetchAllApexRestMetadata
parameter.description: If checked then Datasense will be performed for all Apex classes in the organization else Datasense will be performed only for the classes in Apex class names. If the organization contains many Apex classes this could cause ConnectionTimeout during Datasense. Default value is false.

parameter.name: apexClassNames
parameter.description: List of Apex class names involved in metadata retrieval via Datasense.

parameter.name: proxyHost
parameter.description: Hostname of the proxy. If this property is not set then no proxy will be used, otherwise a proxy will be used, but a proxy host must be specified.

parameter.name: proxyPort
parameter.description: Port of the proxy. If host is set then this property must be set and cannot be a negative number.

parameter.name: proxyUsername
parameter.description: Username used to authenticate against the proxy. If this property is not set then no authentication is going to be used against the proxy, otherwise this value must be specified.

parameter.name: proxyPassword
parameter.description: Password used to authenticate against the proxy.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Username used to initialize the session

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password used to authenticate the user

parameter.name: securityToken
parameter.description: User's security token. It can be omitted if your IP has been whitelisted on Salesforce

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: Web service URL responsible for user authentication. This is the URL for the endpoint that is configured to handle SOAP authentication requests.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: poolingProfile
parameter.description: Characteristics of the connection pool

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the consumer will wait for a response before it times out. Default value is 0, which means infinite.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the consumer will attempt to establish a connection before it times out. Default value is 0, which means infinite.

parameter.name: clientId
parameter.description: Client ID for partners

parameter.name: timeObjectStore
parameter.description: An ObjectStore instance to use in SalesforceExtension#getUpdatedObjects

parameter.name: batchSobjectMaxDepth
parameter.description: Creating a batch will create SObjects using this value for the MAX_DEPTH check.

parameter.name: disableSessionInvalidation
parameter.description: If set to true then the session will not be invalidated when the connection pool deems the connection is no longer needed. This could be useful if you use the same username from several applications and get the same session from Salesforce. Default value is false.

parameter.name: allowFieldTruncationSupport
parameter.description: If true, truncates field values that are too long, which is the behavior in API versions 14.0 and earlier. <p/> Default is false: no change in behavior. If a string or text area value is too large, the operation fails and the fault code STRING_TOO_LONG is returned.

parameter.name: useDefaultRule
parameter.description: If true, the default (active) assignment rule for a Case or Lead is used. If specified, do not specify an assignmentRuleId. If true for an Account, all territory assignment rules are applied, and if false, no territory assignment rules are applied. Default value is false.

parameter.name: clearNullFields
parameter.description: If false, then in order to clear a field its name must be provided in an update request in the 'fieldsToNull' field, otherwise, for clearing a field it can also be simply added to the request with the value 'null'. Default value is false.

parameter.name: consumerKey
parameter.description: The OAuth consumerKey as registered with the service provider

parameter.name: consumerSecret
parameter.description: The OAuth consumerSecret as registered with the service provider

parameter.name: authorizationUrl
parameter.description: The service provider's authorization endpoint URL

parameter.name: accessTokenUrl
parameter.description: The service provider's accessToken endpoint URL

parameter.name: scopes
parameter.description: The OAuth scopes to be requested during the dance. If not provided, it will default to those in the annotation

parameter.name: resourceOwnerId
parameter.description: The resourceOwnerId which each component should use if it doesn't reference otherwise.

parameter.name: before
parameter.description: The name of a flow to be executed right before starting the OAuth dance

parameter.name: after
parameter.description: The name of a flow to be executed right after an accessToken has been received

parameter.name: listenerConfig
parameter.description: A reference to a <http:listener-config /> to be used in order to create the listener that will catch the access token callback endpoint.

parameter.name: callbackPath
parameter.description: The path of the access token callback endpoint

parameter.name: authorizePath
parameter.description: The path of the local http endpoint which triggers the OAuth dance

parameter.name: externalCallbackUrl
parameter.description: If the callback endpoint is behind a proxy or should be accessed through a non direct URL, use this parameter to tell the OAuth provider the URL it should use to access the callback

parameter.description: A reference to the object store that should be used to store each resource owner id's data. If not specified, runtime will automatically provision the default one.

operation.name: create
operation.description:
Adds one or more new records to your organization's data.

IMPORTANT: When you map your objects to the input of this message processor keep in mind that they need to match the expected type of the object at Salesforce.

Take the CloseDate of an Opportunity as an example, if you set that field to a string of value "2011-12-13" it will be sent to Salesforce as a string and operation will be rejected on the basis that CloseDate is not of the expected type.

The proper way to actually map it is to generate a Java Date object, you can do so using Groovy expression evaluator as #[groovy:Date.parse("yyyy-MM-dd", "2011-12-13")].

operation.name: findDuplicates
operation.description: Performs rule-based searches for duplicate records. The input is an array of salesforce objects, each of which specifies the values to search for and the type of object that supplies the duplicate rules. The output identifies the detected duplicates for each object that supplies the duplicate rules. findDuplicates() applies the rules to the values to do the search. The output identifies the detected duplicates for each sObject.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Type of sobjects to find duplicates for

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: List of SObject used as a criterion when searching for duplicates

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: findDuplicatesByIds
operation.description: Performs rule-based searches for duplicate records. The input is an array of IDs, each of which specifies the records for which to search for duplicates. The output identifies the detected duplicates for each object that supplies the duplicate rules. findDuplicatesByIds() applies the rules to the record IDs to do the search. The output identifies the detected duplicates for each ID.

parameter.name: ids
parameter.description: List of id's to find duplicates.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

operation.name: getUpdatedObjects
operation.description: Retrieves the list of records that have been updated between the last time this method was called and the current server timestamp. Salesforce API ignores the seconds portion of the specified dates so subsequent calls of this operation should take place at a rate of at least one minute, otherwise the operation will not return any results for the subsequent calls.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Object type. The specified value must be a valid object for your organization.

parameter.name: initialTimeWindow
parameter.description: Time window (in minutes) used to calculate the start time (in time range) the first time this operation is called. E.g: if initialTimeWindow equals 2, the start time will be the current time (now) minus 2 minutes, then the range to retrieve the updated object will be (now - 2 minutes; now). After first call the start time will be calculated from the object store getting the last time this operation was executed

parameter.name: fields
parameter.description: The fields to retrieve for the updated objects

parameter.name: updateHeaders
parameter.description: Salesforce Headers More Info

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getUpdatedRange
operation.description: Retrieves the list of individual records that have been created/updated within the given time frame for the specified object.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Object type. The specified value must be a valid object for your organization.

parameter.name: start
parameter.description: Starting date/time (Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) not local timezone) of the time frame for which to retrieve the data. The API ignores the value for seconds in the specified dateTime value (for example, 12:30:15 is interpreted as 12:30:00 UTC).

parameter.name: end
parameter.description: Ending date/time (Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) not local timezone) of the time frame for which to retrieve the data. The API ignores the value for seconds in the specified dateTime value (for example, 12:35:15 is interpreted as 12:35:00 UTC). If it is not provided, the current server time will be used.

operation.name: upsertMultipleBulk
operation.description:
Upserts a homogeneous list of objects: creates new records and updates existing records, using a custom field to determine the presence of existing records. In most cases, prefer { #upsert(String, String, List, Map)} over { #create(String, List, Map)}, to avoid creating unwanted duplicate records.

This call uses the Bulk API. The creation will be done in asynchronous fashion.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the given objects. The list of objects to upsert must be homogeneous.

parameter.name: externalIdFieldName
parameter.description: Contains the name of the field on this object with the external ID field attribute for custom objects or the idLookup field property for standard objects.

parameter.name: objects
parameter.description: The objects to upsert

parameter.name: batchSobjectMaxDepth
parameter.description: Async SObject recursive MAX_DEPTH check

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: since
parameter.description: Please specify a date in the YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss format (i.e. 2017-03-17 16:30:40). If this field is empty, this operation will retrieve the selected objects from the time the Mule app is started.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: schedulingStrategy
parameter.description: Configures the scheduler that triggers the polling

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

source.name: replay-channel
source.description: Subscribe to a streaming channel. First the streaming channel must be published and after that a subscription to that channel created. Attention: Salesforce lets you subscribe to an inexistent streaming channel but won't send you notifications after the topic is created.

parameter.name: streamingChannel
parameter.description: The name of the streaming channel to subscribe to

parameter.name: replayOption
parameter.description: Enum with the following values: ONLY_NEW: -1 Subscriber receives new events that are broadcast after the client subscribes. ALL: -2 Subscriber receives all events, including past events that are within the 24-hour retention window and new events sent after subscription. FROM_REPLAY_ID: Subscriber will receive only events with replay id value greater than specified replayId

parameter.name: replayId
parameter.description: Subscriber receives all events after the event specified by its replayId value. The value is ignored if replay option is set on ALL or ONLY_NEW.

parameter.name: autoReplay
parameter.description: if true, when source is started it will start to consume data from when it was left last time

parameter.name: bufferSizeInBytes
parameter.description: Default value it's set to 26 MB, if the messages are not consumed fast enough and the buffer gets filled up it will result in a IllegalStateException

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

source.description: Salesforce stores events for 24 hours and allows you to retrieve stored and new events. Subscribers can choose which events to receive by using replay options.

FROM_REPLAY_ID: Subscriber will receive only events with replay id value greater than specified replayId

parameter.name: contactId
parameter.description: ID of the Contact into which the lead will be merged (this contact must be associated with the specified accountId, and an accountId must be specified). Required only when updating an existing contact.IMPORTANT if you are converting a lead into a person account, do not specify the contactId or an error will result. Specify only the accountId of the person account. If no contactID is specified, then the API creates a new contact that is implicitly associated with the Account. To create a new contact, the client application must be logged in with sufficient access rights. To merge a lead into an existing contact, the client application must be logged in with read/write access to the specified contact. The contact name and other existing data are not overwritten (unless overwriteLeadSource is set to true, in which case only the LeadSource field is overwritten). For information on IDs, see ID Field Type.

parameter.name: accountId
parameter.description: ID of the Account into which the lead will be merged. Required only when updating an existing account, including person accounts. If no accountID is specified, then the API creates a new account. To create a new account, the client application must be logged in with sufficient access rights. To merge a lead into an existing account, the client application must be logged in with read/write access to the specified account. The account name and other existing data are not overwritten. For information on IDs, see ID Field Type.

parameter.name: sendEmailToOwner
parameter.description: Specifies whether to send a notification email to the owner specified in the ownerId (true) or not (false, the default).

parameter.name: opportunityName
parameter.description: Name of the opportunity to create. If no name is specified, then this value defaults to the company name of the lead. The maximum length of this field is 80 characters. If doNotCreateOpportunity argument is true, then no Opportunity is created and this field must be left blank; otherwise, an error is returned.

parameter.name: doNotCreateOpportunity
parameter.description: Specifies whether to create an Opportunity during lead conversion (false, the default) or not (true). Set this flag to true only if you do not want to create an opportunity from the lead. An opportunity is created by default.

parameter.name: overWriteLeadSource
parameter.description: Specifies whether to overwrite the LeadSource field on the target Contact object with the contents of the LeadSource field in the source Lead object (true), or not (false, the default). To set this field to true, the client application must specify a contactId for the target contact.

parameter.name: opportunityId
parameter.description: The ID of an existing opportunity to relate to a lead during lead conversion.

parameter.name: stream
parameter.description: A stream containing the data. This parameter defaults to payload content.

parameter.name: ignoreWarnings
parameter.description: Indicates whether a warning should allow a deployment to complete successfully (true) or not (false).

parameter.name: purgeOnDelete
parameter.description: If true, the deleted components in the destructiveChanges.xml manifest file aren't stored in the Recycle Bin. This option only works in Developer Edition or sandbox organizations; it doesn't work in production organizations.

parameter.name: rollbackOnError
parameter.description: Indicates whether any failure causes a complete rollback (true) or not (false).

parameter.name: maintainSessionRequestFrequency
parameter.description: Time in seconds the connector will hit Salesforce api in order to maintain the session

parameter.name: initialDelay
parameter.description: Initial delay in seconds the connector will wait until making the first keep-alive request, default is 480, that is the minimum amount of time the session can be updated for a session of 15 minute
